segment.source: View a Recording Status
segment.target: View a Recording Status

segment.source: View a Recording Status
segment.target: View a Recording Status

segment.source: View a Recording Status
segment.target: View a Recording Status

segment.source: After you start a recording in Windows Performance Recorder (WPR), you can follow the status of the recording as it transpires.
segment.target: After you start a recording in Windows Performance Recorder (WPR), you can follow the status of the recording as it transpires.

segment.source: This article describes the recording status.
segment.target: This article describes the recording status.

segment.source: When you start a recording by using the WPR user interface (UI), the recording status immediately displays on the WPR screen.
segment.target: When you start a recording by using the WPR user interface (UI), the recording status immediately displays on the WPR screen.

segment.source: If you start a recording by using the WPR command-line interface, you can view the recording status by using either of the following methods:
segment.target: If you start a recording by using the WPR command-line interface, you can view the recording status by using either of the following methods:

segment.source: In the command prompt window, type .
segment.target: In the command prompt window, type .

segment.source: For more information about this command, see WPR Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about this command, see WPR Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Open the WPR UI.
segment.target: Open the WPR UI.

segment.source: The status of the recording that you started from the WPR command line will display.
segment.target: The status of the recording that you started from the WPR command line will display.

segment.source: For more information about how to use these methods to start a WPR recording, see Start a Recording and WPR Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information about how to use these methods to start a WPR recording, see Start a Recording and WPR Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: WPR can only display a recording’s status if the recording is started by WPR.
segment.target: WPR can only display a recording’s status if the recording is started by WPR.

segment.source: It cannot display recording status for recordings that are started by Xperf or other applications.
segment.target: It cannot display recording status for recordings that are started by Xperf or other applications.

segment.source: The recording status displays the following information:
segment.target: The recording status displays the following information:

segment.source: Recording Time: This is the length of time that the recording has been running.
segment.target: Recording Time: This is the length of time that the recording has been running.

segment.source: Buffer: This is the buffer size that the recording is using.
segment.target: Buffer: This is the buffer size that the recording is using.

segment.source: It is displayed in both MB and percentage of available pooled memory.
segment.target: It is displayed in both MB and percentage of available pooled memory.

segment.source: Events dropped: The number of lost events since the recording was started.
segment.target: Events dropped: The number of lost events since the recording was started.

segment.source: For more information about this issue, see Avoid Lost Events.
segment.target: For more information about this issue, see Avoid Lost Events.
